results.title: Parting shots from animals
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb, Christopher Rawlence and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”.
Based on essays by John Berger, the film looks at how man’s exploitation of animals has affected himself. From a variety of locations ranging from circuses to slaughterhouses, the evolution of man’s attitude to animals is traced.

results.title: Three looms waiting
results.creator_credit: Ronald Smedley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”
Portrait of an English drama teacher, Dorothy Heathcote. Shows her work in Tyneside with a variety of young people from an approved school, a junior school, and a hospital for the mentally handicapped.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Passing through Sweden
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, John Kemeny, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film critic of one of Sweden’s daily newspapers says of this film by Martin Duckworth, “Never before have I seen a film that so intensely interpreted the experience of Swedish surroundings … an atmosphere film” in which all the expression is in the pictures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Duckworth, John Kemeny, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Shooting through
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Six of the best”.
Introduces issues concerned with welfare funding, job hunting and the responsibility of employers. Antoni loses his job at the service station and Sal continues to look for secretarial work, but with no success. Founding is cut for the drop in centre.

results.title: Knockbacks
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Six of the best”.
Introduces issues about employers and the workplace, casual work and family relationships. Antoni finds a short lived labouring job; Brian walks off his job after an argument with the foreman; Sal is still looking for work in the face of lack of family understanding and Brian’s father is retrenched.

results.title: Pairing off
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Six of the best”.
Introduces issues concerned with living away from home, multicultural differences and male and female relationships. Carl and Theresa move in together and their Italian parents cannot accept this. Paula goes out with Gary who has a cynical approach to business and personal relationships.

results.title: Early starters
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Six of the best”.
Raises several definitions of work by looking at the various forms of employment and unemployment situations in which the six school leavers find themselves.

results.title: Pay day
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Six of the best”.
All of the six school friends have found employment except Carl and Sal, who has found her way to the local government support drop in centre. Raises issues about relations with employers, assistance for the unemployed and peer groups. Follow on from “Passing out”. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Six of the best
results.brief_description: This series looks at issues which affect young adults in their daily life. Six teenagers, Brian, Antoni, Carl, Paula, Sally and Theresa deal with such problems as employment, school and relationships. Passing out, Early starters, Pay day, Pairing off, Shooting through, and Knockbacks.
